subject: RE: [junit] Passing parameters to methods
msgSnippet: ... This thread demonstrates that it s far from obvious.  Very often, you do want your test methods to use some kind of parameters.  All I m saying is that
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> > This has nothing to do with JUnit. What if you want to pass
> > parameters to one test method but your other test methods have no
> > interest in those parameters?
>
> Then they don't belong into the same TestCase class. Isn't
> that obvious?

This thread demonstrates that it's far from obvious. Very often, you do
want your test methods to use some kind of parameters. All I'm saying is
that it's more intuitive to pass these parameters to the test method
directly rather than passing them in the constructor of the test class and
looking them up later.

--
